Analysis of the synovial fluid obtained during an exploratory puncture reveals :

- the presence of inflammatory joint fluid (cellularity greater than 2,000 nucleated cells/mm<sup>3</sup>, sometimes very high up to 100,000/mm<sup>3</sup>), predominantly neutrophils

- Negative results from routine bacteriological tests (possible combination!)

- Inconsistent presence of microcrystals.

properties.question: What is a key characteristic of the inflammatory fluid obtained during an exploratory puncture in the context of microcrystalline arthropathies?
properties.option_b: Cellularity greater than 2,000 nucleated cells/mm^3, often neutrophils
properties.option_c: Normal cellularity with a high number of monocytes
properties.option_d: Absence of inflammatory cells and presence of microcrystals
